title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-1.12 - Default in appearance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-1.12 - Default in appearance

State Regulations
(a) In
the event a party fails to appear or to be represented at an adjudicatory
proceeding, such proceeding shall go forward on the record and a determination
may be rendered thereon or the proceeding may be discontinued in accordance
with section 187-1.13(j) of this Subpart. (b) Within 15 days of default or service of a
copy of the determination, whichever is later, a defaulting party may make
written application to the commissioner to open a default. The commissioner
may, for good cause shown, open a default and take such further action as
justice may require. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8187-1.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
